intro: Dysosma veitchii, commonly known as the Veitch's dysosma, is a climbing plant native to China. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces unique, spiral-shaped flowers that are often greenish or yellowish in color. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
